docs.lead_paragraph: The few who make it to the big leagues or top college levels can make six-figure salaries, while others can make good part-time incomes.

headline.main: Earning Their Stripes as Umpires and Referees

docs.abstract: Sports officiating provides an agreeable part-time job to many, and it can be possible to turn job into full-time living; still, landing one of more than 300 coveted and lucrative positions in big-league sports remains difficult prospect; officiating camps and professional schools offer aspiring officials a way in.
docs.snippet: The few who make it to the big leagues or top college levels can make six-figure salaries, while others can make good part-time incomes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Programs at U.C.L.A. and Columbia keep health professionals and those entering the field up to date on the issues surrounding the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: New Health Law Is Sending Many Back to School
headline.print_headline: New Health Law Is Sending Many Back to School

docs.abstract: University of California, Los Angeles and Columbia University are offering programs aimed at keeping health professionals abreast of changes stemming from Affordable Care Act; changes may lead to new career opportunities for professionals with best understanding of law and how it is being put into practice.
docs.snippet: Programs at U.C.L.A. and Columbia keep health professionals and those entering the field up to date on the issues surrounding the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Bond Insurer Files Suit Against Detroit in Setback for Bankruptcy Plan
headline.print_headline: Bond Insurer Files Suit Against Detroit in Setback for Bankruptcy Plan

docs.abstract: The Financial Guaranty Insurance Company wants to be paid back for the $1.4 billion it claims it loaned Detroit’s pension fund in 2005.

docs.lead_paragraph: A fugitive Sicilian mafioso arrested in Britain last year after living a quiet suburban life under an alias for two decades won a battle against extradition on Monday when the court found that Italy's prison overcrowding could breach his human rights.

docs.lead_paragraph: For those at the low end of the hourly wage scale, even meeting basic household needs can be a stretch, and roads out of poverty are scarce.

headline.main: Low-Wage Workers Are Finding Poverty Harder to Escape

docs.abstract: Workers at low end of hourly wage scale are finding it easier to fall into poverty, and finding it harder to meet even basic household needs and to escape poverty; nearly 25 million workers in United States make less than $10.10 an hour, amount to which Pres Obama supports increasing minimum wage.
docs.snippet: For those at the low end of the hourly wage scale, even meeting basic household needs can be a stretch, and roads out of poverty are scarce.
